Data Privacy Notice & Procedures

This document outlines how we use personal information and explains the rights of individuals regarding its use.

Developed by: Fusion Finance
Date: January 2018

Table of Contents

• Background

• What is Personal Data

• Requirements by Law

• What is Legitimate Interest

• Consent

• Where do we get Personal Data

• To Whom do we pass Personal Data

• How Long do we Keep Personal Data

• Living Individuals Rights

• Appendix D: Template Data Privacy Notice

• Appendix E: Template Website Privacy Notice

Background

We understand that personal data is important to individuals and it is equally important to us. Our Privacy Notice explains what we use personal data for and outlines the rights of individuals regarding its use. Please read this document to understand how and why we use personal data. We use personal data to provide business services, comply with legal and regulatory obligations, and for legitimate business purposes such as advising, arranging transactions, setting up plans, and assisting customers with claims and encashments. Data is shared with relevant product producers to facilitate these processes. If we receive personal information about someone else, we must ensure we have their permission and inform them of our Data Privacy Notice.

What is Personal Data

Personal Data

Personal data refers to data relating to a living individual who can be identified from the data. This includes personal details, family and lifestyle details, education and training, employment details, financial details, contractual details, and online identifiers like IP addresses and cookies.

Sensitive Personal Data

Sensitive personal data, or special categories of personal data, include medical details, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, trade union membership, data concerning health or sex life, sexual orientation, race, ethnic origin, genetic data, and biometric data. Although personal data relating to criminal convictions and offenses are not included in this category, similar extra safeguards apply to its processing.

Automated and Manual Data

Automated Data refers to information collected or processed by a computer operating automatically based on given instructions. Manual Data refers to information recorded as part of a relevant filing system or intended to form part of such a system.

Privacy by Design and Default

Privacy by Design means that any action involving personal data processing must consider data protection and privacy at every step. This includes internal projects, product development, software development, IT systems, and more. Privacy by Default means that the strictest privacy settings should apply automatically once a product or service is released, without requiring manual input from the end user. Personal data provided should only be retained as long as necessary to provide the service.

Requirements by Law

We must have a lawful basis to collect and use personal data, processing it lawfully, fairly, and transparently. Individuals have the right to be informed about our lawful basis for processing their data, which must be determined before processing begins. Data processing should be relevant, adequate, and limited to what is necessary for its purpose. If the same purpose can be achieved without processing the data, then no lawful basis exists.

Request to Swap the Original Purpose

We should not change the lawful basis for processing data without good reason and must always consult the Compliance Officer. If necessary to change the lawful purpose, it may be possible to continue processing under the original lawful basis if the new purpose is compatible with the initial one, unless the original basis was consent.

Processing Special Category Data

Processing special category data requires identifying both a lawful basis for general processing and an additional condition for processing this type of data. The lawful bases for processing include consent, contract, legal obligation, and legitimate interests. Separate conditions for processing include explicit consent, processing necessary for employment and social protection law, vital interests protection, legitimate activities with safeguards, data made public by the subject, and legal claims or judicial capacity.

Contract

We collect and use personal data to provide a plan contract, including name, date of birth, contact details, bank account details, financial information, health details, employment details, and pension and salary information. This data is used to process applications, issue plans, provide plan information, customer care, service, and to inform of relevant actions.

Required By Law

We use personal data to comply with laws and regulations, including reporting to regulators, maintaining records, internal reporting, quality checks, compliance controls, and audits. We collect personal information to comply with Anti-Money Laundering laws, conduct customer due diligence, and complete financial reviews to recommend suitable financial products.

What is Legitimate Interest

We use personal data for legitimate interests that benefit our customers, including employment data processing, fraud detection, financial crime prevention, network and information security, compliance with law enforcement, court and regulatory requirements, insurer relations, industry practices, financial modeling, and marketing.

Consent

We require consent to collect and use personal data, explaining its purpose and how consent can be withdrawn. Consent must be informed, unambiguous, and proactive. Individuals have the right to withdraw consent at any time and to be forgotten. Consent cannot be a condition for the execution of a contract or service provision.

Where do we get Personal Data

We obtain personal data directly from individuals through contact, forms, interactions, and our website or social media accounts. We also receive personal data from solicitors, employers, regulators, and create new personal information based on interactions.

To Whom do we pass Personal Data

We pass personal data to companies that act as service providers under contract, processing personal information as instructed. Data is transferred securely and not used for other purposes. We also pass personal data to product producers, investment service providers, regulators, and third parties with recorded consent, all within the EU.

How Long do we Keep Personal Data

We retain personal data as long as there is a relationship with the individual and after, as necessary for complaints handling, system back-ups, and regulatory compliance. We confirm retention periods when individuals avail specific services.

Living Individual’s Rights

Individuals have several rights regarding their personal data, which can be exercised free of charge by contacting us. We will verify the identity of the data subject and respond within one month in line with GDPR regulations. Rights include:

• Right to Information: Individuals must be informed of any updates to the Privacy Notice or changes in personal data collection and use.

• Right to Restrict or Object: Individuals can restrict or object to unfair and unlawful data collection or use, including automated decision-making and direct marketing.

• Right to Correct and Update: Individuals can request corrections or updates to their personal data.

• Right to Delete and Be Forgotten: Individuals can request deletion of personal data if it is incorrect or processed unfairly or unlawfully.

• Right to Portability: Individuals can request a copy of their personal data in a machine-readable format.

• Right to Access: Individuals have the right to know what personal data is held about them and receive a copy.

Risk and Control Review / Assessment

The firm will periodically assess any gaps in DP Policies, ensuring updates for GDPR compliance. Data protection practices will be reviewed annually, or as needed, to address identified gaps and ensure data security.

Training

Fusion Finance conducts monthly training on data privacy and monitors adherence to procedures.

Queries

The Compliance Officer handles all data protection matters, including general queries and requests from data subjects. Queries should be directed to Marie Davey, Compliance Officer at Fusion Finance.

Definitions

• Data: Information in a form that can be processed.

• Automated Data: Information on computer systems.

• Manual Data: Information recorded as part of a relevant filing system.

• Relevant Filing System: A structured set of information for easy access.

• Personal Data: Data relating to a living individual who can be identified.

• Sensitive Personal Data: Specific categories of data requiring extra safeguards.

• Data Controller: An entity controlling personal data processing.

• Data Processor: A body processing personal data on behalf of a data controller.

• Data Subject: An individual who is the subject of personal data.

• Processing: Operations performed on data, including obtaining, using, altering, and disclosing data.

Suggestions for additions to this glossary should be directed to the Compliance Officer.
